children.subject: Your assumption is correct that since this is a departmental change, there will be no impact on your GPA nor will the unit amount actually change on your transcript. It will only change to 4 units internally.

I have a couple of questions:

1. WIll the unit change impact our current GPA? (could be negative or positive since more units have a greater impact on gpa)

2. If it does impact our GPA, will it affect it retroactively after graduation? (for graduating seniors)

3. If so, is there a way to make it remain 3 units?

I'm assuming (1) is a "no" because this is a departmental unit change.

Thank you so much!
If you take the class this summer and it hasn't yet officially changed to 4 units, which is unlikely, you can submit to the form. Please wait until you're actually enrolled to submit.
Will this change / form also be available for those who want to take CS W169A this summer?
As far as the advisors are aware, there have been no discussions of unit changes for any other CS/EECS classes.
Will the same happen to CS 61C an EE 16B for this semester?
Yes, exactly. It could also count as 4 units of tech electives or 4 units of design, whatever the student needs to fulfill.
purrrrrr
Hi! I was just wondering if departmental credit for the class means it will count as 4 units for CS upper div requirements instead of 3 or does it mean something else?
Yes, that's correct.

^ "It could also count as 4 units of tech electives or 4 units of design" in the follow-up above - I see on the website that CS 169 fulfills the design requirement, so CS W169A offered this summer also satisfies 4 units of Design course?

I believe the workload is still the same, but the faculty determined that the workload was worth 4 units instead of 3. I don't know about the summer format. Please check with the instructors listed on classes.berkeley.edu.

I heard last summer some students took CS W169A over the summer and then CS169L (which involves a semester-long project) during the semester. So is the workload for CS W169A still the same as before, or does the change in units mean students actually need to complete the semester-long project in the summer? Asking specifically about CS W169A offered this summer. Thanks.
Same thing here, will CS 169A this Fall count as 3 or 4 units towards meeting the CS major requirements?

The unit update is being worked on, but we don't know when the change will officially happen yet. If you took CS169A for 3 units, we will count it toward the design requirement, however. You will still only receive 3 units officially, but for CS and EECS major purposes, we'll count it as 4 units.
Just to clarify, If we take CS 169A in Fall 2021, do we have to fill out the form for it to count as 4 units for CS major upper-division requirement? Or is it automatically applied as 4 units?
We're still not sure if the units will be changed in time for fall, so once you enroll in the class for this fall, you can fill out the form and then we'll follow up, as needed.

<md>Does the same policy apply to CS 169A offered in fall semester or is this only for CS W169A in the summer? If not, does CS 169A and CS 169L satisfy the 4-unit design course requirement for L&S CS?</md>
Yes. Internally only, like for CS, meaning no change on your transcript, but it will count toward your EECS requirements as 4 units.
Will this extra unit also be counted in the 40 Engineering Units required for EECS since the 40 units also include the 20 Upper div units?
The original post acknowledges the change is unlikely to happen before fall, so yes this summer is included.
Will the counting 3 units as 4 units form be updated to include an option for Summer 2021 if the 4 unit change isn't done by then? Thanks

We're not sure if the 4 unit change will be reflected for Fall 2021. To answer your question you are correct, the exception of counting the course as 4 units will go towards the 20/20 UD EECS units, and the 40/40 required Engineering units, but the exception does not go towards the 120 units needed for graduation. I will follow up with you about filling out the form once I get more information next week.
Alright, thanks!
Are there any updates on this?
No updates yet. Please know that I will update you once we know. Thank you for your patience.
Sorry but when can we expect an update on this? ^^^

Should I fill out the form if i'm expected to graduate in Fall 2021 (Assuming it is 3 units I will have > 120 units in total but 19/20 units required for EECS and subsequently 39/40 required Engineering units) Will the change to 4 units be reflected by then to make sure I have 20/20 and 40/40 required units respectively for EECS in time and is the assumption that I will get the additional unit in those categories but not the 120 units correct?

We can't guarantee when this will be resolved. What we can guarantee is that whether you take 169A for 3 units or 4 units, it will fulfill design and count internally for the CS and EECS majors. Nothing will change on your transcript, but it will satisfy your major requirements.

Since the department is working on the unit update, right now can the department guarantee that the course would be counted as 4 units if I submit the form? Or we have to wait until everything has been finalized? The information is critical for me at this point since I'm graduating this Fall and my total unit design classes is 19/20, including CS 169 I plan to take this Fall.
If I'm taking CSw169A this summer to fulfill the 4 units of a Design Course, do I need to fill out the form above? If so, when should I do it? Thanks.

history.content:
For EECS and L&S CS students who took CS W169A in past semesters:

Professor Armando Fox is in the process of sending through the paperwork to the University that will change CS W169A from a 3 unit to a 4 unit course because it has a greater workload than he envisioned when he created the course. 

This process may take some time, and he and Professor Ball wanted to create a way for EECS and CS students who have already taken the class to get departmental credit for 4 units for taking this class (non CS & EECS majors would need to work with their own departments). These procedures have no impact on your unit totals with the University.  If you have 119 units, for example, you won’t be able to tell L&S or COE and the University that W169A is actually worth 4 units, and you should be at 120.

If you are an L&S CS major, and you wish to use CS W169A, which you took for three units, to replace one four unit upper division course for the CS major, you can fill out this form.

If you are an EECS major, and you want to use EECS W169A, which you took for three units, to replace one four unit upper division course for the EECS major, you can fill out this form.

EECS, CS, and EIS minors don’t need to be concerned about this issue, since we accept either 4 unit or 3 unit courses for your upper division coursework.

Students in other majors who have taken CS W169A will not be impacted by these policies until CS W169A is approved as a 4 unit course by the Committee on Courses of Instruction (COCI), which is unlikely to take effect before Fall 2021.

Any questions may be directed to Antoine Davis (L&S CS) or me (Heather Levien for EECS).
history.subject: Change in CS W169A Unit Value

<sp>

Professor Armando Fox is in the process of sending through the paperwork to the University that will change CS W169A from a 3 unit to a 4 unit course because it has a greater workload than he envisioned when he created the course. 

<sp>

This process may take some time, and he and Professor Ball wanted to create a way for EECS and CS students who have already taken the class to get departmental credit for 4 units for taking this class (non CS & EECS majors would need to work with their own departments). These procedures have no impact on your unit totals with the University.  If you have 119 units, for example, you won’t be able to tell L&S or COE and the University that W169A is actually worth 4 units, and you should be at 120.

<sp>

If you are an L&S CS major, and you wish to use CS W169A, which you took for three units, to replace one four unit upper division course for the CS major, you can fill out this form.

<sp>

If you are an EECS major, and you want to use EECS W169A, which you took for three units, to replace one four unit upper division course for the EECS major, you can fill out this form.

<sp>

EECS, CS, and EIS minors don’t need to be concerned about this issue, since we accept either 4 unit or 3 unit courses for your upper division coursework.

<sp>

Students in other majors who have taken CS W169A will not be impacted by these policies until CS W169A is approved as a 4 unit course by the Committee on Courses of Instruction (COCI), which is unlikely to take effect before Fall 2021.
